page.title: 12WATTS GALLERY COMPTON
page.content: {George Frederic Watts}was a famous Victorian painter and sculptor who built a country house for himself to escape the London Fogs. The house was {Limnerslease}in{Compton}and Andrew took us to see the house in which he now lives.{The Watts Gallery,}with hundreds of paintings, still only has 10% of Watts work and was opened in 1904. With the exception of Good Friday, Christmas Eve and Christmas Day it is open every day of the year. It also contains some of his original sculptures. There are portraits, landscapes and a series of paintings showing life for the poor. Mrs. Watts ran a pottery in Compton for many years and built the nearby {Memorial Chapel}in the cemetery. This is an ornate, decorated building, bright-red because local clay was used for the bricks.
